title: Population of Michigan , by race and ethnicity 2018
summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of residents in each Race on the y axis.
Race White alone has the highest Number of residents and Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone has the lowest Number of residents.
There is a difference of 7472757.0 between the maximum Race White alone and minimum Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of residents for 8 number of Races.
The Number of residents is highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of residents in each Race on the y axis.
Race White alone has the highest Number of residents and Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone has the lowest Number of residents.
There is a difference of 7472757.0 between the maximum Race White alone and minimum Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of residents for 8 number of Races.
Race White alone has the highest Number of residents and Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone has the lowest Number of residents.
Race Black or African American alone has the second highest value for Number of residents.
The highest Race White alone has 7472757.0 more Number of residents than the lowest Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
Number of residents at Race White alone is 7476047.0 , second place is Black or African American alone at 1363183.0, and thirdly is Hispanic or Latino (of any race) at 517381.0.
The highest value 7476047.0 at White alone is almost 5.98 times larger than the average value 1249489.38.
Summing up the values of all Races, we get total 9995915.0.
